title: Protected sign-up viewer page requiring authentication

requirements.text: Create a dedicated protected page (e.g., '/signups') that displays the list of all players who have signed up for Blue Panthers. The page must require the user to be signed in via Internet Identity before the sign-up list is shown. If the user is not authenticated, display a prompt to sign in rather than the list.

quotes: make a page on the app that you have to sign in to see who signed up for blue panthers

acceptanceCriteria: A new route (e.g., '/signups') is registered in App.tsx and accessible via navigation.
Unauthenticated users see a sign-in prompt instead of the sign-up list.
Authenticated users see a table of all Blue Panthers sign-up entries fetched from the backend.
The page includes login and logout controls consistent with the rest of the app's design.
The page is reachable via a navigation link in the app header or menu.

requirements.text: Expose or reuse the existing backend query that returns all sign-ups so the new protected page can fetch the full list of sign-ups for authenticated callers. Ensure the query is accessible to any authenticated user (not only admins) if that is the intended access level, or confirm it remains admin-gated.

quotes: make a page on the app that you have to sign in to see who signed up for blue panthers

acceptanceCriteria: The backend exposes a query that authenticated callers can use to retrieve all sign-up records.
Unauthenticated (anonymous) callers receive an error or empty result from this query.
The existing admin-gated query is not broken by any changes.

constraints: Do not modify files under frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, or frontend/src/components/ui.
All Motoko logic must remain in the single backend/main.mo actor.
nonGoals: Changing or replacing the existing AdminPage.
Adding filtering or sorting to the new page (not requested).
Implementing a new authentication mechanism beyond Internet Identity.
